subsection.title: Writing and Presenting for Graduate Students

introduction.p: My take in how you can organize your thesis, as well as presentation slides for your PhD defence (QE is the same).
Tips about writing thesis: word document and main map

I consider structure to be the most important consideration. To have structure, first write a series of questions to drive the report (revise it many times), and with the (finalised) questions, generate a power point file to provide more contents towards answering the questions. Repeat until satisfied, and then write the report. See Chong's example below as well as PhD ProofReader's template (see below) Writing Template

Similarly to prepare for PhD presentation (typically 40-45 mins), write also a series of questions to focus on the structure, and with questions, generate the slides, and finally articulate it. See Khassan's example below.
Have a look at Yingzhu's Qualifying Exam (QE) preparation (details below). She proposes ideas on slide preparation and provided a link to the video recordings of the presentation as reference.
